title: Death toll reaches 29 as monster storm continues to ravage the US
description: The storm is expected to claim more lives but heat and lights are steadily being restored across the country.

title: 'Dear soldier': Letters from Russian children reflect grip of Moscow propaganda
description: On December 9, in the Ukrainian city of Izium, our reporters found a hundred letters written by Russian children and teenagers to their countrymen on the frontlines of the invasion of Ukraine. They reveal the propaganda orchestrated by Moscow.

title: Algerian authorities seal premises of last free media outlet Radio M, arrest director
description: Ihsane El-Kadi, who runs Radio M, was arrested over the week-end, about 60 kilometers east of Algiers.

title: In the French Alps, one town wrangles over cross-country skiing project
description: The town of Mont-Saxonnex illustrates the environmental concerns in mountainous areas around development projects and the difficulties in finding alternative revenue streams to downhill skiing.

title: Christmas in Kyiv: 'We will not let the Russians steal the holidays'
description: Despite the restrictions and the tributes to the many dead from the war, Ukrainians festively celebrated the Christian holiday on December 24.

title: King Charles hails UK public 'solidarity' in first Christmas message
description: The monarch praised charities and religious establishments for their generosity in times of economic woes.

title: Post-covid, cross-country skiing becomes the new Alpine craze
description: The closure of ski lifts during the Covid-19 pandemic allowed the sport to gain a new following. The industry, which is very small, is trying to restructure itself to accommodate this renewed interest.

title: Israel: Netanyahu rebukes far-right ally for anti-LGBT comments
description: Orit Struck, a Religious Zionist, said her party would seek to allow discrimination against LGBT+ people in places like hospitals.

title: Nepal: Former guerrilla leader Prachanda returns as prime minister
description: The Maoist leader, who has served as prime minister twice, will govern with a coalition of seven parties.

title: 'Avatar': 'Do not confuse animal mawkishness with environmental action'
description: Frédéric Ducarme, a researcher in environmentAL philosophy, analyzes James Cameron's latest film and argues it is misleading to call it an 'environmental fable.'

title: Syrian Kurds protest against Paris attack
description: Three Kurds in Paris were killed by a 69-year-old man who said he had a 'pathological' hatred of foreigners.

title: Putin says West wants to 'tear apart' Russia
description: The Russian president said his war against Ukraine is supposed to 'unite the Russian people'.

title: Pope urges end to 'senseless' Ukraine war in Christmas message
description: The head of the Catholic Church urged for an end to the use of 'food as a weapon'.

title: Suspect in Paris killing of Kurds admits to 'pathological' hatred of foreigners
description: The 69-year-old man killed three Kurds in an attack against a Kurdish cultural center in the French capital on Friday. He was placed in a psychiatric facility.

title: China's propaganda struggles to find new tone after zero-Covid policy abandoned
description: After three years of defending the extremely strict Chinese approach by demonizing the virus, the official discourse has to adapt to a new situation and is struggling to convince the public.

title: Lionel Messi and the Wise Men. Does anyone care?
description: For some of us, the pictures of Argentina's triumph following the World Cup final in Qatar are like twisting the knife in the wound. One last look, promised.

title: After Paris killing, Kurdish community refuses to believe attack was only racist
description: Thousands of Kurds demonstrated on Saturday in Paris to denounce a politically-motivated attack. The suspect said he was motivated by racism before being transferred to a psychiatric ward.

title: Fabio Quartararo: 'I really rode at the limit all season'
description: The first French MotoGP world champion failed to retain his title in 2022, beaten by Italy's Francesco Bagnaia. The rider looks back on the past year.

title: In Japan, Jesus' miraculous tomb
description: According to mysterious manuscripts destroyed during World War II, Christ spent time in Japan, just like Buddha, Moses and Confucius. Far from dying on the cross, he is said to have been buried in a village in the north of the country. The legend is part of the local folklore and attracts tourists.

title: 18 trapped in Xinjiang gold mine collapse
description: A total of 40 people were working underground at a mine in Yining county, about 100 kilometers from the border with Kazakhstan, at the time of the collapse Saturday afternoon.

title: Troops deployed in San Salvador amid massive gang crackdown
description: More than 2,000 soldiers and police surrounded two districts in El Salvador's capital on Saturday as part of President Nayib Bukele's war on gangs.

title: Tree, manger, Yule log: What do these Christmas symbols all mean?
description: What is that heavily decorated tree doing in the living room? And that delicious cake shaped like a log on the table? Who are these anachronistically dressed figurines? Here's what's behind these Christmas symbols that are sometimes more spiritual than we think.

title: 18 die as monster storm brings, rain, snow, cold across US
description: The storm unleashed its full fury on Buffalo, New York, on Saturday, with hurricane-force winds causing whiteout conditions. Emergency response efforts were paralyzed, and the city’s international airport was shut down.

title: The silk scarf is squarely coming back in style
description: Whether worn as a kerchief or around the neck, with a classic or bold pattern, it is the ultimate emblem of elegance – and how you decide to style it is entirely up to you.

title: In Germany, Greens divided on 'criminal' nature of environmental organization
description: The hard-hitting actions of the Letzte Generation movement have not met with unanimous approval among the Green party members of the coalition.

title: In Iran, doctors come to the rescue of protesters
description: Caregivers assist injured protesters outside of public hospital facilities, where they risk arrest.
